Description: Ostracon, fragment of the base and body of a wine-jar, made of pale-red pottery, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip, with remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text on the exterior, identifying original contents of vessel as wine of the Western River for the Aten domain, year 8 (of Akhenaten).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (389859) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/389859)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Domain of Aten
